lines.gurmukhi: jYsy bIrwrwDI imstwn pwn Awn khu; Kuvwvq mMgwie mwNgY Awp nhI Kwq hY [

Unknown.translation: Just as worshipper of brave (in Sikand Puran 52 Bir's Nandi, Bhirangi, Hanuman, Bhairav, etc. are mentioned) asks for sweet, distributes to all but does not eat any himself.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijvyˆ bIr AwrwDnw krn vwlw imTweI pwn Awid mMg ky mMgvwauˆdw hY, qy horwˆ nUM KuvwldwhY, pr Awp nhIˆ Kwˆdw[

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy dRum sPl Plq Pl Kwq nwNih; pQk pKyrU qor qor ly jwq hY [

Unknown.translation: Just as a tree bears sweet fruits but does not eat them itself. Instead birds, travellers pluck and eat them.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijvyˆ Plwˆ sihq Pldw ibRC Awp Pl nhIˆ Kwˆdw, pr rwhI qy pMCI qoV qoV ky lY jwˆdy hn[

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qO smuMdR iniD pUrn skl ibD; hMs mrjIvw hyir kwFq sugwq hY [

Unknown.translation: Just as ocean is full of all sorts of precious pearls and stones but those who have swan like temperament dives in it and relish them.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijvyˆ smuMdr qwˆ sB qrHwˆ dIAwˆ inDIAwˆ kry Awp pUrn hY, pr aus qoˆ hMs Aqy mr jIauVy l`B l`B ky sugwqwˆ Amolk rqn k`Fdy hn[

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy inhkwm swD soBq sMswr ibKY; praupkwr hyq suMdr sugwq hY [564[

Unknown.translation: Similarly, there are many saints and hermits (who have no self interest and are always ready to do good to others without any gain to themselves) their lives become successful helping others.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ausy qrHwˆ sMswr ivc inSkwm swDU soBdy hn, ijnHwˆ dw suMdr srIr hY hI praupkwr vwsqy ]564]
